ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A lot about traditional Buddhism
Core Buddhist teachings, different schools of Buddhism, meditation, and a different way to approach spirituality
I learned more about foundational thought surrounding Buddhism and its Atheist opponents.

There was so much to learn and unpack with this course that I would take it again if I could. Every week was a new lesson that Professor Kim would share personal anecdotes and teachings about. Likewise, I learned a lot from my classmates, who would share their interpretations of the readings and teachings that I would never have considered otherwise.

I learned many valuable skills and insights through taking this course. I've learned about the history, teachings, and varying viewpoints of Atheism and Buddhism. More importantly, this course allowed me to reflect on my own beliefs and assumptions about religion and spirituality.
I learned different methods to meditate. I learned how to engage with spiritual and religious texts and beliefs in a way that allows me to be open minded while still analytical.
Incredible seminar.
Understanding of the different views of Buddhism from different perspectives!
I learned about different aspects and branches of the Buddhist tradition, as well as how its relationship with atheism has been analyzed by scholars.
I developed a deeper understanding of Atheism and Buddhism and how principles from both of these topics can be used to better my life.
A much deeper understanding of Buddhism and contemporary Buddhism
I learned a lot about mindfulness and how to apply it for the betterment of my life.
I gained a deeper understanding of Buddhist tradition and atheist ideology and I feel that I learned new ways to add mindfulness to my life.
I learned a lot about the extremely diverse terrain of modern Buddhism, as well as practical skills in meditation and practical knowledge of Buddhist thought.
introductions to buddhism and atheism

I learned about the founding of Buddhism and its core religious tenets, which vary somewhat geographically and across different strains of the ancient religion. I learned about the adoption of Buddhism in the west and engaged in interesting debates about whether atheistic or agnostic adaptations of Buddhist practice constitute Buddhism as such.
Reflecting on my own life and experience. Really learned a lot on the core tenets of Buddhism and now have a strong foundation
On buddhism
I learned about the foundations of Buddhist philosophy and how it has changed over time to adapt to western beliefs and science.
The core fundamentals of Buddhism as well as how they relate to current topics and ideas.
Broadened worldview
Understanding of the key concepts of Buddhism, and the major topics of current debates between Atheists and Buddhists.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Kim is an amazing professor.
I wish the lectures better aligned with the readings. I felt like there was a big disconnect from class and the hw. I definitely learned a lot but it didnt feel organized.

Strength: great professor, a wide range of materials, and small group discussions
Weaknesses: some of the course materials could be improved (e.g. the videos on reincarnation were poor quality and did not add much insight) and lacked sufficient structure in some areas (e.g. not much guidance on student presentations, so the presentations sometimes ended up being very long or unrelated to the course)

Strengths: great reading and video materials in the syllabus, professor is wonderful, small-group discussion based
weaknesses: speakers were so fun and interesting -- I wish we had maybe 1-2 more of them!

A strength of this course was the overall lesson plan structure. It was nice to know what to expect for each week. I think I would have enjoyed doing the readings summaries before group discussion so that people who didn't get around to reading that week could still participate in the group discussions.

Strengths: I enjoyed the structure of the class. I appreciated how we began each class with a mini lecture led by Professor Kim, followed by a student-led discussion based on the weekly readings. 

No notable weaknesses.

The large person seminar wjth a combination of lecture and discussion section worked great, especially for the almost 2 hour time period. The break midway was helpful. My favorite part about the class was the mix of upper and lower class-men which created very interesting and complex conversations.

Professor Kims enthusiasm and care for this class is the greatest strength. He genuinely cared about what we could take from the course for life. He always made an effort to invite speakers and converse with us.
A great overview of Buddhism that takes into account many views and takes on past and present day Buddhism
I think if there were less reading I would have done more-just felt impossible to read a book in a read so didnt try very hard

This class should not have had 50 people in it. I went into the class so excited but I was pretty disappointed when I found out I'd be listening to undergrads talk for like 20 minutes every class about their experience with psychedelics or mindfulness. I think this class had a lot of potential (and actually did actualize its potential in previous years, according to the course reviews) but the class was way too big.
This course was fascinating and a breath of fresh air from other courses. The professor and the positive attitude of the students is a strength. That amount of reason, however, is infeasible.

Strengths: Professor Kim is amazing. Diversity of topics.

Weaknesses: None
Strength: Professor Kim is so kind
Readings were very interesting and the guest speaker lectures were also fascinating.
Group discussion was very engaging.

This course was so amazing. I loved the discussion-based aspect of the class, all of the readings were very thoughtfully chosen, and Professor Kim did such an amazing job keeping everyone engaged and making everyone feel welcome. There is not one thing I would change about this course.

The leminar format allowed many more people to benefit from the class than a traditional seminar would have, but as a result discussions didnt progress as smoothly. My favorite parts of the class were the lecture components.
strengths are Hwansoo, could be improved through organization
I thought this course was wonderfully structured. The seminars were engaging and thought-provoking, and the readings were very intriguing.

The lectures could be a bit more logically organized with key takeaways and points and more connections explicitly made about how the content relates to the overall religion and where it fits in. I really liked the readings though!
None

Strengths: Hwansoo is an amazing Professor. He really cares about all of his students and is very knowledgable about Buddhism. The weekly topics were really interesting and made me reflect on my own beliefs. Weaknesses: Sometimes the topics felt repetitive. I felt like we were reading similar readings over and over again. I would have like to explore certain topics in greater depth.
I loved this course! I really like how it incorporated both lectures, discussions, and speakers. No improvements necessary!
I very much enjoyed the course readings and class discussions. Hearing different perspectives and personal experiences of my peers was a joy.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's a great learning environment.
Absolutely take this course. It was one of the best I've taken at Yale.
YES!! I loved this class, and Professor Kim is a lovely teacher. I loved the small group work and the source material on the syllabus.
Yes!!! Professor Kim really cares about this content and it shows with every lesson he gave. The people taking this course were so open to the teachings and it made for a great class environment.
Yes, I would recommend this course to every student at Yale.

YES for sure 
I love Hwansoo and I love learning about Buddhism, especially because you learn a lot of stuff that is applicable and useful in your life
Take this class at the very least for Prof. Kim. He is such an excellent professor and is deeply caring and interested in his students.
Absolutely. Professor Kim is an incredible teacher with so much knowledge and experience to share. I think everyone should take this class or a class by Professor Kim.
Yes, if nothing else to learn about a new philosophy and religion
Yes! Professor Kim is amazing and you wont regret it:)
If it's taught in a proper seminar format, absolutely! If not, well, it'd be a good fifth credit.
Yea, it was a very positive experience.
Yes, I developed a much deeper understanding of an important world religion, along with gems of wisdom to improve my everyday experience

This is by far the course I would recommend most to other Yale students. I recommend it all the time to other students in random conversations on campus because it is so meaningful, engaging, and lovely.
Definitely. One of the best classes Ive taken at Yale. Left feeling truly changed with a new understanding of myself and my life.
yes, if you want a low-stakes course to learn about buddhism and atheism.
I would 100% take this course if you have the opportunity!

Nice class. At times could feel too theoretical and I didnt know how it applied to my life, but most of the content was really relevant. I was going through a rough week because of something else while I was writing my final paper, and my topic allowed me to see my own clinging and attachment in the situation and actually made me feel better.

Really loved the guest speakers (Sumi and the psychedelic guest lecture)
Yes
Yes! If they are interested in a basic overview of what Buddhism is.
Absolutely! The professor was amazing and the course content was super interesting. Really changed the way I approach my life-- a positive change.
yes of course, it was a beautiful class
Yes. I think it is important to take the time to reflect on your own values and beliefs through actively engaging with different ideas and perspectives.
